page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our grid area lies to the west of the town of Nelson in Lancashire.It is predominantly an area of fields and moor,the highest point being 338 metres above sea level.But it also contains the local golf course,two reservoirs,a disused quarry site and part of the village of Trawden. The area is served by minor roads and numerous footpaths.It is drained by the early tributaries of Colne Brook and by Catlow Brook.Catlow Brook lies in a steep wooded valley and is crossed by a ford. The main occupants of the area are farmers,although several farms are no longer worked commercially.
